input:
1. A 15-year-old female is referred to the genetics clinic due to progressive loss of peripheral vision and increasing difficulty seeing at night that began around age 12. She also reports frequent urination and excessive thirst, with recent onset of mild hypertension noted during a routine check-up. Physical examination reveals postaxial polydactyly on the left foot and central obesity with a body mass index in the 98th percentile. Cognitive assessment demonstrates borderline intellectual functioning with some learning difficulties at school. Ophthalmologic evaluation identifies pigmentary retinal changes consistent with retinitis pigmentosa. Renal function tests are mildly impaired, and ultrasound reveals structural renal abnormalities including mild bilateral hydronephrosis. Endocrine workup uncovers delayed menarche and hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Genetic sequencing identifies biallelic pathogenic variants in the BBS14 gene, confirming Bardet-Biedl syndrome 14, and a multidisciplinary care plan is initiated.
What brings you in today?
output:
THINKING: I need to explain my symptoms clearly but honestly, without sounding like I have all the answers. I should mention my vision issues and the other things I’ve been feeling, and maybe express how worried or confused I am about everything. I want to seem straightforward but not overthink it.

ANSWER: I’m 15, and I’m a girl. Well, I guess I’ve been having a really hard time seeing in the dark and, like, my peripheral vision is worse, especially over the last few years. Also, I keep needing to go to the bathroom a lot and feel really thirsty all the time. Sometimes I feel kind of tired and a little dizzy, and I don’t know, everything just feels more complicated than it used to.

input: 1. A 15-year-old female is referred to the genetics clinic due to progressive loss of peripheral vision and increasing difficulty seeing at night that began around age 12. She also reports frequent urination and excessive thirst, with recent onset of mild hypertension noted during a routine check-up. Physical examination reveals postaxial polydactyly on the left foot and central obesity with a body mass index in the 98th percentile. Cognitive assessment demonstrates borderline intellectual functioning with some learning difficulties at school. Ophthalmologic evaluation identifies pigmentary retinal changes consistent with retinitis pigmentosa. Renal function tests are mildly impaired, and ultrasound reveals structural renal abnormalities including mild bilateral hydronephrosis. Endocrine workup uncovers delayed menarche and hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Genetic sequencing identifies biallelic pathogenic variants in the BBS14 gene, confirming Bardet-Biedl syndrome 14, and a multidisciplinary care plan is initiated.Can you tell me more about how your vision has changed over time and whether you're experiencing any other symptoms or issues that concern you?
output: Um, well, my vision's been getting worse... I can't see really well in the dark anymore, and I sometimes feel like things are shadowy or blurry. It’s kinda scary because I don’t know when it’s gonna get worse. And besides that, I keep needing to pee a lot and I’m super thirsty all the time. My body feels different too, and I don’t really get why… it’s just a lot to deal with.

She also reports frequent urination and excessive thirst, with recent onset of mild hypertension noted during a routine check-up. Physical examination reveals postaxial polydactyly on the left foot and central obesity with a body mass index in the 98th percentile. Renal function tests are mildly impaired, and ultrasound reveals structural renal abnormalities including mild bilateral hydronephrosis. Endocrine workup uncovers delayed menarche and hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Genetic sequencing identifies biallelic pathogenic variants in the BBS14 gene, confirming Bardet-Biedl syndrome 14, and a multidisciplinary care plan is initiated.Can you tell me more about how your vision has changed over time, and are there any other symptoms or concerns you've noticed that haven't been discussed yet?
output: Um, well, my vision… it’s been getting worse, like everything is darker and harder to see, especially at night. Sometimes I see flashes or spots, and I don’t know if that’s normal. And I guess I’ve been really thirsty and needing to pee all the time, but I don’t know if that has anything to do with my eyes or…” (pauses and looks down) “I also feel kinda tired and sometimes a bit… out of it, like I’m not thinking straight or forgetful. It’s all kind of a lot to figure out.

input: 1. A 15-year-old female is referred to the genetics clinic due to progressive loss of peripheral vision and increasing difficulty seeing at night that began around age 12. She also reports frequent urination and excessive thirst, with recent onset of mild hypertension noted during a routine check-up. Physical examination reveals postaxial polydactyly on the left foot and central obesity with a body mass index in the 98th percentile. Cognitive assessment demonstrates borderline intellectual functioning with some learning difficulties at school. Ophthalmologic evaluation identifies pigmentary retinal changes consistent with retinitis pigmentosa. Renal function tests are mildly impaired, and ultrasound reveals structural renal abnormalities including mild bilateral hydronephrosis. Endocrine workup uncovers delayed menarche and hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Genetic sequencing identifies biallelic pathogenic variants in the BBS14 gene, confirming Bardet-Biedl syndrome 14, and a multidisciplinary care plan is initiated.Could you tell me more about when you first noticed these vision changes, how they have progressed over time, and whether you experience any other symptoms such as headaches, eye pain, sensitivities to light, or neurological issues?
output: Um, I guess I started noticing that I couldn’t see as well in the dark, like I’d be walking and start bumping into stuff or having trouble seeing the stairs. It’s been getting worse, and sometimes I see like little flashes or spots, I guess. No idea about headaches or pain, but certain lights, like really bright lights, kinda bother me sometimes. I don’t really feel anything else besides just being confused about it all.

output: I guess I started noticing it pretty slowly over the last couple of years, but it’s gotten worse recently. I’m not really sure if anyone else in my family has similar eye or brain stuff—no one’s ever really talked about it, so I don’t know.

output: Umm, I haven't really had any recent blood tests done myself, at least not that I remember. Sometimes I get like really thirsty and go to the bathroom a lot, but I haven’t noticed any weakness or weird feelings in my body or anything like that. My thinking’s been a little cloudy at times, but I’m not sure if that’s normal or not.

output: Um, I’m not totally sure how all of this is connected. It’s a lot to take in, but I guess I’m okay with trying what you recommend. Maybe it will help me feel better or make things easier.
